quickCheck.title: Quick OHS Compliance Check
quickCheck.subtitle: Answer 10 simple questions and discover your compliance level with Romanian OHS legislation.
quickCheck.footer: This questionnaire is 100% free and requires no registration.

q1.text: Do you have updated Medical Fitness Certificates for all employees?
q1.description: According to Law 319/2006, all employees must have periodic medical examinations.

q2.text: Does your organization have an updated Risk Assessment from the last 12 months?
q2.description: Risk assessments must be reviewed annually or when significant changes occur.

q3.text: Do you have a signed and implemented Prevention and Protection Plan (PPP)?
q3.description: PPP is a mandatory document that establishes OHS prevention measures.

q4.text: Have employees received OHS training at hiring and periodically?
q4.description: Initial and periodic training is mandatory according to OHS legislation.

q5.text: Are workers designated and trained for emergency situations (Fire Safety)?
q5.description: You must have trained workers for first aid and emergency situations.

q6.text: Is Personal Protective Equipment (PPE) distributed and recorded?
q6.description: Employees must receive appropriate PPE for their role and risks.

q7.text: Are fire safety equipment (extinguishers, hydrants) periodically inspected?
q7.description: Technical inspection of fire extinguishers must be done annually by authorized personnel.

q8.text: Do you have a valid Fire Safety/ISU Authorization for your building/activity?
q8.description: Fire Safety Authorization must be renewed periodically according to risk category.

q9.text: Are workplace accidents investigated and reported according to law?
q9.description: Any workplace accident must be reported to ITM within the legal deadline.

q10.text: Do you have an active contract with external OHS service or in-house specialist?
q10.description: The employer must ensure OHS services internally or externally.

recommendations.title: Priority recommendations
low: Ensure valid medical certificates for all employees
Periodically check fire safety equipment (extinguishers, first aid kit)
medium: Provide appropriate PPE (protective equipment) for each position
Conduct periodic medical checks according to risks
Annual fire safety equipment inspection by authorized companies
high: URGENT: Hire dedicated OHS specialist or contract external service
Conduct detailed risk assessment for all positions
Implement PPP and ensure monitoring of prevention measures
Intensive OHS and Fire Safety training for all employees (2x/year minimum)
Monthly inspections of work at height conditions
Emergency plan and trained intervention team
Valid Fire Safety authorization and updated security scenarios
veryHigh: CRITICAL: Specialized OHS consultant dedicated to organization
Complex risk assessment with external expertise (chemical, construction, pressure)
Prevention and protection plan reviewed quarterly
Weekly/monthly OHS training for critical areas
Daily inspection of critical equipment (pressure, height, substances)
Professionally trained Fire Safety team + quarterly evacuation drills
Real-time incident monitoring and reporting system
